topic.title: Linking In Lightweight DITA
topic.shortdesc: There are several different types of links available for use to help with retrivability and easy navigation of your content. These links include hiearchial links, inline links, related links, and collection type links.

section.title: Hierarchial Links
section.p: These nested topics reveal the navigation of information through a topic hierarchy: parent, child, and sibling topics. They are automatically linked to each other by creating this type of link.

section.title: Inline Links
section.p: These type of links connect users to related information by being inserted in the text of the topic. This is done by using the <xref> element.

section.title: Related Links
section.p: These links are inserted in a relationship table. Because these links are less common and harder to create, see Chapter 7 in the text referenced below to if you need to learn more about them.

section.title: Collection Type Links
section.p: These type of links are set in the DITA map because they create links among a group of nested topics. You can apply this attriubte on <topicref> and <topicgroup> elements in a DITA map. For more information on sequence, choice, unordered, and family collection types, see Chapter 7 in the text referenced below.
